alert.note: Alert for District of Columbia (District of Columbia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 23 at 1:37AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from earlier this evening is expected. * WHERE...A portion of DC, including the following : District of Columbia. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 136 AM EDT, Stream gauge readings along Rock Creek indicated that flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of The North Central District of Columbia - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
